meanings: [명사] threat (of), menace (to), intimidation, [동사] threaten, menace, intimidate

examples.korean: At night, the dark streets become menacing. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 밤이면 어두운 거리가 위협적이 된다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary

examples.korean: Jack Frost was threatening to kill the new plants. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 서리가 새로 심은 화초들의 목숨을 위협하고 있었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Jack Frost was threatening to kill the new plants. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: The threat of punishment has only stiffened their resolve. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 처벌 위협은 그들의 결의를 강화시켰을 뿐이다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The threat of punishment has only stiffened their resolve. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: The forests are being menaced by major development projects. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그 숲들이 거대 개발 사업들로 위협받고 있다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The forests are being menaced by major development projects. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Environmental damage threatens the whole of civilization. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 환경 파괴가 전 세계 사람들에게 위협이 되고 있다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
